events.name: Null SG Sept Meetup - News Bytes, Understanding MS Office sandbox & Car Hacking
events.description:
Null meets are free for anyone to attend. There are absolutely no fees. Just come with an open mind and willingness to share and learn Agenda:  Introduction & Networking : 15 mins News Bytes : 15 mins Understanding the Microsoft Office 2013 Protected-View Sandbox (45 mins) by Yong Chuan. Automotive Networks and Security: Apples and Oranges ? (45 mins) by Philipp Mundhenk.  Abstract of the talk(s): 1. News BytesIt will cover the latest news on information security that were in headlines in last month. 2. Understanding the Microsoft Office 2013 Protected-View Sandbox by Yong Chuan KohSandboxing is a popular modern technique used by vendors to minimize the damages that attackers might inflict on a compromised system by restricting the application’s trust boundaries. Sandboxing raises the bar for exploitation because the compromised application is now “contained”, and typically need at least another vulnerability to escape the sandbox container to achieve the same level of system compromise. As a testament of its effectiveness, popular applications that have adopted sandboxing technique include Chrome, Internet Explorer, Firefox and Adobe Reader. Microsoft Office is no exception; its sandbox is implemented as the Protected-View feature since Office 2010. At present, there are many excellent sandbox researches for Chrome, Internet Explorer Enhanced Protected Mode and Adobe Reader. However there is no similar research for the Microsoft Office Protected-View sandbox yet.This talk aims to bridge this gap. The first part of this talk will sketch the Protected-View sandbox internals by discussing about its architecture, its initialization sequence and the system resource restrictions. The second part will discuss the Inter-Process Communication (IPC) mechanism, including the mode of communication, undocumented objects involved, format of IPC messages and the semantics of selected IPC messages. 3. Automotive Networks and Security: Apples and Oranges ?In recent weeks, the media was full of news on car hacking and the insecurities in car computer systems. The described scenarios are reminiscent of attacks on computers and computer networks. Why is that? Are cars really insecure? And why have existing security measures not been applied in cars? 


This talk will give a short introduction into the world of computerized cars and give lots of examples for security in car networks. How do car networks look like? Where are differences and similarities to computer networks? Where does security come in?The talk will also touch on a few solutions for the challenges in car security, including some of the solutions proposed by the speaker and his team. Speaker(s) Bio:Yong Chuan is a security researcher in the MWR Labs. He mainly likes to find vulnerabilities and exploit them. Philipp Mundhenk received a Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Engineering (Network and Software Engineering) from the University of Cooperative Education Baden-Württemberg Lörrach (Duale Hochschule Baden-Württemberg Lörrach, DHBW) and the National University of Singapore (NUS) and a Bachelor of Engineering with Honours from the Open University London, both in 2010. In 2012 he earned his Master’s Degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Technische Universität München (TUM) and the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST). Since 2012, Philipp has been working as Research Associate at TUM CREATE and pursuing a PhD from TUM. His current research interests are centered around security for automotive networks, with a special focus on authentication protocols and verification tools for secure automotive architectures.Speaker’s full CV is available at: https://www.mundhenk.org/about Directions & Venue Map : Map: Please see the meetup map or follow below street view map. https://www.google.com/maps/@1.280919,103.847042,3a,75y,317.56h,95.79t/data=!3m4!1e1!3m2!1sVb_jjHjK7OEtOoaHIfwSpQ!2e0?hl=en Streetdirectory: http://www.streetdirectory.com/sg/car-park-amoy-street-a0006/30317_1.html Landmark: Its opposite to Car Park Via MRT: ThoughtWorks(TW) office is 3 mins away from Telok Ayer MRT (DT, purple line) . TW office is 7 mins walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT (green line), take Exit G and take a left till you reach a right turning road and look for 87 B.
events.location: Thought Works,  Level 3, 87B Amoy Street, 069906, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Hackware v1.1
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Agenda & Talks for this meetup:

1. (20min) Bluemix+IOT using node-red - Nikolay Vlasov / Justin Lee 

2. (20min) Tespa, Espresso and Esp-201 boards - William Hooi

3. (20min) Particle Electron and Slide-Clicker - Kenneth Lim

4. Announcements by anyone on:
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

5. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members

Talks : ~20mins
Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Announcements: ~1min

Sponsors:

Venue provided by Plug-In@Blk71: http://www2.blk71.com
Food/Drinks provided by IBM Bluemix: http://bit.ly/bluemixsg
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Lean Beer
events.description: Grab a beer, be merry and have a Lean Coffee style discussion. We will be focusing on the topics that are of interest to you. Anything from Kanban (duh), Scrum, Lean, Lean UX, Lean Startup, Agile practices to issues that you are addressing with the team today. Topic generation will be from 6:30 - 6:45pm. Discussion from 6:45pm onwards Beginners to experts are all welcome! (Trying a new venue. Open for feedback.)
events.location: Stuttgart Blackforest Boutique S-Café, 9 Bras Basah Road, #01-01 Rendezvous Hotel Gallery, Singapore

events.name: Investment Trends in Southeast Asia -- How Investors Look at the Region? by @Justin Hall
events.description:
[This is a repeat session because of overwhelming demand on the first session on 18 Sep]

This session is intended to help attendees understand how investors look at potential investments and close deals. It'll not only cover broad investment trends in Singapore and Southeast Asia, but will also help entrepreneurs understand such complex issues like determining when to raise, understanding key terms on a term sheet, and how to pitch to investors.

Justin Hall is Principal at Golden Gate Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund based in Singapore but investing across Southeast Asia, Taiwan, and Hong Kong.

As principal, he manages Golden Gate Ventures' existing portfolio while sourcing investments across APAC. In addition, he is director for Golden Gate Ventures Annex Fund, focused on follow-on funding for existing portfolio companies.

IMPORTANT NOTES FOR ATTENDEES:

* Venue sponsor: NUS Enterprise as usual! :-)

* NUS Enterprise/Plugin has moved to #02-09, so look for the new space right by the stair case on Level 2, Blk 71! Do not go to the old location at #02-18

events.name: Friday Hacks #98: NUS SOC Print & Bluetooth Low Energy
events.description:
We'll have Kheng Meng, a recent SoC graduate as our speaker for this Friday Hacks. He'll be covering the SoC Printing system as well as an introduction to Bluetooth Low Energy.

As always, free pizza is served before the talk. See you there!

Talk 1: NUS SoC Print (Software talk)
Find out how the NUS SOC Print apps work behind the scenes. Kheng Meng is also looking for developers to take over these projects.

Talk 2: Introduction to Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) (Hybrid hardware/software talk)
BLE is a new and emerging wireless communication standard that was only ratified in 2010. Designed primarily to save power, it is not backward-compatible with the conventional Bluetooth we are all familiar with. Find out how to harness this technology for your hardware projects with live demos and coding examples involving the Arduino, Raspberry Pi, Android and iOS.

Speaker Profile:
Kheng Meng is a recent Computer Science graduate from NUS SoC. He developed both the Android and iOS versions of the NUS SoC Print apps that are still in use today. He used to work at a hardware startup Innova Technology which makes Bluetooth anti-loss devices. After graduating, he is now a hardware developer at Algo Access, a med-tech startup providing solutions for optometrists.

events.name: Git for Beginners - hackerschool
events.description:
Ever used Dropbox to store your code because it makes backups? Made multiple copies of your assignment's folder just to try different things? Worked on group projects by coding in Google Docs? Git is the tool for you: it'll change the way you code for the better.

Workshop open to everyone, no prior knowledge required. Own laptop needed.

Please register here: http://goo.gl/forms/Ezx7bJUrIr
events.location: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, National University of Singapore

events.name: Mentorship session
events.description: Mentorship session in HackerSpace.SGWe will continue discussing type classes.
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: Oct/2015 - Open Space (Metrics)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Rohit Arora from Barclays Open Space Theme: Metrics Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology.  Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT). Building Access The building requires someone from Barclays to allow people into the lift and to the room. Rohit from Barclays will be at the reception area to help you enter the building. The timings he will make the trip are: 7:00pm, 7:15pm and 7:30pm There is no guarantee of trips after 7:45pm.
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
anGie Seah, with Ian Woo, Aya Sekine and Speak Cryptic
Thursday 8 October, 8pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

Inspired by the phrase ‘Butterflies in the stomach’, anGie Seah attempts to present the physical spectacle of our hearts and guts manifesting such sensations. In a mash up of unpredictable drumming, piano tapping, bass droning, erratic voice-works combined with everyday sounds, anGie together with Ian Woo, Aya Sekine and Speak Cryptic reinterpret emotions and ideas that spoken words fail to evoke. Where words and emotions share no common ground, this immense audio-visual experience will trigger your senses through the orchestra of sounds, actions and imagery. Get ready to open your hearts and minds at this live performance not to be missed.

In partnership with the NTU CCA Singapore Residencies Programme.

events.name: From the Endangered to the Sublime: Global Eco-systems
events.description:
From the Endangered to the Sublime: Global Eco-systems 
Saturday 10 October 2015
2pm to 5pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

From the Endangered to the Sublime: Global Eco-systems is a half-day Conversations event bringing together leading researchers, artists and scientists for a debate about the world around us and its rich and fragile biodiversity. 

As part of ArtScience Museum’s Art and Science of Sustainability season, this event will highlight a number of exciting areas of research, including marine science and environmental management. 

Noted speakers include Eric Valli, the photographer behind the breath-taking images of our exhibition: Living Yangtze for Swarovski Waterschool, as well as eminent scientists and researchers including Michael Aw, author, explorer and conservation photographer. The day will be hosted by Kevin Teng, Executive Director of Sustainability at Marina Bay Sands.

This event is part of ArtScience Museum’s Art and Science of Sustainability season which aims to create awareness about the environment through a series of sustainability-themed activities, talks and workshops.

events.name: Global Cardboard Challenge
events.description: Long time Maker Faire participant and Maker mom Elda Webb is initiating the first global Cardboard challenge to be held in Science Centre. This fantastic initiative also aims to reach out to children from underpriviledged backgrounds and bring Making to them. Stay tuned for details

events.name: Spatial Visualization and Analysis with R
events.description: Hello everyone, for our next session, we'll take a break from learning about data mining algorithms; Nielsen will be giving us a workshop on Spatial visualizations with R. Here is a short synopsis of the session (there will be a hands-on portion so do bring along your laptops with the pre-req packages). And yes, there will be food. Synopsis:With the growing volume of digitized spatial information available, knowledge of spatial visualization and analysis will be extremely useful skills to have for a data scientist. In this session, we will share some basic spatial visualization and analysis using R based on some of the work we do. The focus will be on the use of Leaflet (for R), one of the powerful libraries for interactive visualization of spatial data. We will also briefly mention a few useful libraries for spatial analysis, and provide a few examples related to the work we do.To make the hands-on session smoother, you may wish to install the following R libraries, as well as the following data set: • Leaflet: devtools::install_github("rstudio/leaflet") • rgdal (CRAN) • rgeos (CRAN) • Dengue data (select the SHP icon): http://data.gov.sg/Metadata/OneMapMetadata.aspx?id=DENGUE_CLUSTER&mid=209760&t=SPATIAL Speaker Bio:Chong Jie (CJ) joined the Nielsen Data Science Singapore Innovation group at the end of last year. Some projects he works on include:Store-matching,  Automation of stratification and sample selection,  Digital Advertisement Ratings, and e-Commerce. At Nielsen, he also had the opportunity to conceptualize and conduct an Introductory R course to provide a hands-on learning approach to associates who wish to pick up R.  Prior to joining Nielsen, CJ worked at the Ministry of Education (MOE) for 8 years, and in the last 4 years with MOE, he led a newly established Data Management Committee for a branch in the MOE headquarters, handling data maintenance, extraction and analysis for the branch.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: DevOpsDays Singapore
events.description: Join us for 2-days DevOpsDays and connect with DevOps professionals from all over the world and share your experiences, ideas, and tools relating to DevOps and Agile. Checkout the program: http://www.devopsdays.org/events/2015-singapore/program! About DevOpsDays DevOpsDays is a 2-days conference that brings development and operations together. We have exciting keynote sessions, talks and open spaces to combine all the benefits of a traditional conference with the benefits of unconference. Why Attend? Whether you're in government, academia, or the private sector, DevOpsDays is for you. Whether you're in operations, development, QA, security, or any other department, DevOpsDays is for you. Whether you want to learn about DevOps, share your experiences, or just talk shop with DevOps practitioners, DevOpsDays is for you. DevOpsDays are a mix of keynote sessions and open spaces. The keynotes and open spaces will include discussions on topics such as:  Register As a member of the DevOps Meetup Group you can use the discount code  'DEVOPS_MEETUP' (without quotes) while getting your ticket to enjoy a discount on your tickets! Register here: <a>https://ti.to/devopsdays-singapore/2015­</a> See you soon! (RSVP is not required and it does not count as registration)
events.location: Raffles City Convention Centre, 80 Bras Basah Rd Singapore 189560

events.name: Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab
events.description:
Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab
17-18 Oct, Sat to Sun, 10am to 6pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

As part of Sunday Showcase, The Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab presents imaginative ways to engage the public in envisioning the future of technology and a Smart Nation. An invited group of participants across art, design and technology will work together to imagine what the future for a Smart Nation could entail. Involving narrative scenarios, critical thinking, participatory art and rapid prototyping, this showcase will aim to produce unique, creative perspectives on the developing landscape evolving around new technology. 

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: FutureEverything Conference: Signals of Tomorrow
events.description:
FutureEverything Conference: Signals of Tomorrow
Saturday 17 October
10.15am -7.30pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

What is a smart nation, and what does it mean to be a smart citizen? How are artists, designers, futurists and civic innovators playing with the technology that is weaving itself into the fabric of our cities, economies and infrastructure? In partnership with ArtScience Museum, FutureEverything’s first ground-breaking conference in Singapore will look at how life, work and play have been fundamentally transformed by technology, and will form part of a national conversation in Singapore on the place of smart technology in society and culture. Noted speakers include critical futurist Scott Smith, designer and Internet of Things expert Alexandra Deschamps-Sonsino, technology critic and fellow of Harvard’s Berkman Institute Sara Watson, lead strategist for globalfutures agenda Cheryl Chung, Nanyang Technical Institutes’ Andrea Nanetti, and the team behind Hello Lamppost, PAN Studios.

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: Front End TL;DR October 2015
events.description:
Have you ever come across something new in front end, had the browser tab open for weeks, but never found time to research it? Use this event as an excuse to dig a little deeper.

Front End TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop. 

For the October meetup we will visit BitTitan, a provider of cloud enablement and data migration solutions. Quite a mouthful. :)

Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how the engineers at Wego ship code.

7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks 
7:15pm — Intro talk by the host 
7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new 
9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned 
9:30pm — The end.

There will be guest wifi, food & drinks provided.

Address:
BitTitan SG Pte Ltd
1 Fusionopolis Way
#05-10 Connexis North Tower
Singapore 138632

Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time.

More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/
events.location: 1 Fusionopolis Way, #05-10 Connexis North Tower, Singapore 138632

events.name: Gophers meetup #11 - Oct 2015 Tuesday
events.description: 1. Valentine Chua - Topic to be confirmed 2. Johan Sim, Zumata - Using gRPC to build microservices 3. gRPC challenge hosted by Zumata Pizzas and drinks are kindly sponsored by ThoughtWorks Singapore at 7pm.

events.name: Business 365 Saturday | Singapore
events.description: October 24, 2015 This is the event to attend in 2015 for in-depth insights from world leading experts in the areas of SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365 and Office. Whether you are looking for technical knowledge, architectural approaches, or business strategy, this is where you will find your answers. We expect to have 15 topic sessions covering all aspects of SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365, and Office 2016. This Business 365 Saturday is a unique event because it is absolutely free, anyone can attend, it won't interfere with your work schedule, and it's planned with a community focus in mind. We bring the experts, consultants, and Microsoft MVPs from around the country to share their experiences, tips, and best practices. You won't get a day of sales pitches, instead you will receive training and the opportunity to network with other users. This is a great opportunity for you to meet other Microsoft professionals in the Singapore community, ask questions, network, and share your experiences. We expect a variety of educational sessions for: • End Users • Power Users • SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365 Administrators • Developers • Project Managers • Architects • IT Strategists & Executives For detail agenda please visit our website http://business365.azurewebsites.net
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Papers We Love #014
events.description:
Paper #1: mov is Turing-complete : Yeo Kheng Meng http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/~sd601/papers/mov.pdf

Paper #2: A Framework for Automated Generation of Questions Based on First-Order Logic : Shubham Goyal 

-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

-----------------

Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love
Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love
Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.A Framework for Automated Generation of Questions Based on First-Order Logic

events.description: TBA: Something to do with Watson!!!
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: SARTS Monthly Meeting - October 2015
events.description: This is our regular monthly meeting, join us to learn more about Amateur Radio and our activities!

events.name: Bicycle restoration workshop
events.description: Do you remember the wacky and fun upcycled bikes at Maker Faire Singapore? Well, Mo and his team from Bikes4Fun will be joining us to facilitate a parent - child bicycle restoration workshop. Details coming soon.

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing?  Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it?  Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too.  Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people.  See you folks!

events.name: Fabric Hacking with Adafruit Flora
events.description: A collaboration with volunteers from Microsoft, as part of the Code for Change programme, Fabric Hacking with Adafruit Flora explores how you can light up your T Shirt or hat. Lets get together for a Halloween themed fun fiesta. Stay tuned for details

events.name: Learn Chef Configuration Management Part 1
events.description: ** Had to bump this due to logistics and availability **The future of management and configuration of the Microsoft platform is Desired State Configuration. Chef is a configuration management product that is fully leveraging the DSC platform is important to the DevOps movement. There is some great content at learnchef.io which I have wanted to go through for a while but have yet to schedule in. So I am scheduling the time to do it.If you would like to Learn Chef too, join me for this Meetup. I cannot provide any expertise on Chef whatsoever, but I can provide a room with a big screen, food, uninterrupted time to watch the content and go through the labs as well as others to discuss with and expertise on DSC.If this sounds like something you'd like to do please come along, let's learn Chef and progress our journey to DevOps.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 13th Nov 2015 7:00pm
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Making things Move
events.description: Make things that twist, turn, pop and move. Parents and children can get hands on together and learn tinkering skills, science and art in this fun workshop. Details coming soon!
